member.name: M:atcMetCmp.UniformDistribution.Generate
member.summary: Generate a random numbers ranging from 0.0 to 1.0. In the process of calculating the random number, the seed (x1) is set to a new value. This function implements the prime-modulus generator xi = 16807 xi Mod(2**(31) - 1) using code which ensures that no intermediate result uses more than 31 bits
member.remarks: the theory behind the code is summarized in Bratley, P., B.L. Fox and L.E. Schrage. 1983. A Guide to Simulation. Springer-Verlag, New York. (pages 199-202), based on code in SWAT2005

member.name: M:atcMetCmp.TriangularDistribution.Generate(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Generate a random number from a triangular distribution given X axis points at start, end, and peak Y value

member.name: M:atcMetCmp.modMetCompute.SolarRadiationFromCloudCover(atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseriesSource,System.Double)
member.summary: Compute daily solar radiation based on daily cloud cover

member.name: M:atcMetCmp.modMetCompute.CloudCoverTimeseriesFromSolar(atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseriesSource,System.Double)
member.summary: Compute daily cloud cover based on daily solar radiation

member.summary: Compute HAMON PET from less than daily air temperature timeseries
member.param: Temperature in Degrees F (True) or C (False)

member.name: M:atcMetCmp.modMetCompute.PanEvaporationTimeseriesComputedByHamon(atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseriesSource,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double[])
member.summary: compute Hamon - PET
member.param: Temperature in Degrees F (True) or C (False)

member.name: M:atcMetCmp.modMetCompute.PanEvaporationTimeseriesComputedByPenman(atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseriesSource)
member.summary: compute Penman - PET
member.remarks: The computations are based on the Penman(1948) formula and the method of Kohler, Nordensen, and Fox (1955).

member.name: M:atcMetCmp.modMetCompute.WindTravelFromWindSpeed(atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseriesSource)
member.summary: compute daily total wind travel (mi) from average daily wind speed (mph)

member.name: M:atcMetCmp.modMetCompute.DisSolPet(atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseriesSource,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Disaggregate daily SOLAR or PET to hourly

member.name: M:atcMetCmp.modMetCompute.SolarRadiationValueFromCloudCover(System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Computes the total daily solar radiation based on the HSPII (Hydrocomp, 1978) RADIATION procedure, which is based on empirical curves of radiation as a function of latitude (Hamon et al, 1954, Monthly Weather Review 82(6):141-146.

member.name: M:atcMetCmp.modMetCompute.CloudCoverValueFromSolar(System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Computes daily cloud cover based on daily solar radiation.
member.remarks: NOTE: This routine makes what is likely a gross assumption - that percent sun, and thus, cloud cover is essentially the ratio of actual solar radiation to potential max solar radiation. Max solar radiation is based on the above routine (RadClc), which uses the HSPII (Hydrocomp, 1978) RADIATION procedure, which is based on empirical curves of radiation as a function of latitude (Hamon et al, 1954, Monthly Weather Review 82(6):141-146.

member.name: M:atcMetCmp.modMetCompute.PanEvaporationValueComputedByHamon(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Generates daily pan evaporation (inches) using a coefficient for the month, the possible hours of sunshine (computed from latitude), and absolute humidity. The computations are based on the Hamon (1961) formula.
member.param: Value to return if problem occurs

member.name: M:atcMetCmp.modMetCompute.PanEvaporationValueComputedByPenman(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Compute daily pan evaporation (inches)
member.remarks: based on the Penman(1948) formula and the method of Kohler, Nordensen, and Fox (1955).

member.name: M:atcMetCmp.modMetCompute.NLDASCloudCoverTimeseriesFromSolar(atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseriesSource)
member.summary: Compute cloud cover based on solar radiation using NASA method requested by Athens ORD lab
member.returns: Cloud Cover timeseries at same times as aSolTSer

member.name: M:atcMetCmp.modMetCompute.NLDASDewpointTimeseriesFromSpecificHumidity(atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseriesSource,System.Double)
member.summary: Compute dewpoint temp based on specific humidity using method requested by Athens ORD lab
member.returns: Dewpint Temperature timeseries at same times as aSpecHumidTSer

member.name: T:atcMetCmp.modPenmanMonteith_SWAT
member.summary: Computes PenmanMonteith PET based on code from SWAT 2005

member.name: M:atcMetCmp.modPenmanMonteith_SWAT.PanEvaporationTimeseriesComputedByPenmanMonteith(System.Double,atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseries,atcData.atcTimeseriesSource,atcMetCmp.SwatWeatherStation,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This version accomodates the use of prepared daily precip, min, max air temp, assuming SI units (mm, C) by default
member.param: Daily min air temp in C
Daily max air temp in C
Inputs are in English unit (Elevft, PRECinch, TEMPF), if true, then output is in English unit (inch PMET)

member.name: T:atcMetCmp.modSWAT_MetUtil
member.summary: Excerpted and translated routines from SWAT
member.remarks: function and subroutine names are taken from SWAT, variable names updated to meet BASINS conventions

member.param: proportion of wet days in a month
average daily solar radiation for the month(MJ/m^2/day)
maximum possible radiation for the day in HRU(MJ/m^2)
parameter which predicts impact of precip on daily solar radiation
